attributes.action: Sheffield City Council: reevaluate parking restrictions around Kelham Island
attributes.additional_details:
Businesses in the Kelham Island area are having their trade strangled by new heavy-handed parking measures which make it impossible for employers, employees and customers to park. 

The many construction developments across Kelham Island have been given free-roam to park as and where they like and forcing Sheffield City Council to enforce parking regulations against residents being able to park within half a mile of their own home.
attributes.background: We, the people of Sheffield, ask Sheffield City Council to reevaluate these new authoritarian parking restrictions (entire streets of double-yellows) in the Kelham Island are, which have left many unable to park near their homes and others unable to park near their place of work.

rejection.details:
The issue you have raised is the responsibility of Sheffield City Council, not of the UK Government or Parliament. If you like, you could start a new petition about this issue with Sheffield City Council using the link below:

 https://www.sheffield.gov.uk/your-city-council/have-your-say/petitions.html
